topic.title: How to Avoid Table Exceeding Page

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p:
The DITA specification indicates that tables should have a fixed layout. This can be done on two different ways:
Using proportional or relative measures: it includes percent values and shares values (e.g. "3*" or "12*").
Using fixed measures: it includes all the values followed by units (e.g. in, pt, px, etc...).
Even though the specification allows combining these values we highly recommend the usage of one method at a time. The association of both methods could lead to a table exceeding the page width and will make the content unreadable.
